Definition: Obesity is a complex disease involving an excessive amount of body fat, which increases the risk of health problems.
Causes: Genetic factors, poor diet, lack of physical activity, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Increased body weight, difficulty with physical activity, and health complications.
Diagnosis: Body mass index (BMI) calculation and clinical evaluation.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Obsessive-compulsive disorder is a mental health condition characterized by persistent, unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic, neurological, and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Intrusive thoughts, compulsive behaviors, and anxiety.
Treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), medications, and support groups.

Definition: Obstructive sleep apnea is a sleep disorder characterized by repeated interruptions in breathing during sleep due to throat muscles relaxing excessively.
Symptoms: Loud snoring, daytime fatigue, and episodes of breathing cessation during sleep.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, CPAP therapy, and surgery in severe cases.

Definition: Optic neuritis is an inflammation of the optic nerve, which can cause vision loss and pain.
Causes: Autoimmune diseases, infections, and multiple sclerosis.
Symptoms: Vision loss, pain with eye movement, and color vision changes.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation, MRI, and visual field tests.
Treatment: Corticosteroids and management of underlying conditions.

Definition: Orbital tumors are abnormal growths located in the orbit, the bony cavity that contains the eye.
Causes: Exact cause is often unknown; may include genetic factors.
Symptoms: Protrusion of the eye, vision changes, and pain.

Definition: Oropharyngeal cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the oropharynx, the part of the throat located at the back of the mouth.
Causes: Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection, smoking, and alcohol use.
Symptoms: Sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and lumps in the neck.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, imaging studies, and biopsy.

Definition: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease characterized by the breakdown of cartilage and underlying bone.
Causes: Aging, obesity, joint injuries, and genetics.
Treatment: Pain management, physical therapy, and joint replacement surgery in severe cases.

Definition: Osteomalacia is a condition characterized by the softening of bones due to vitamin D deficiency.
Causes: Vitamin D deficiency, malabsorption, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Bone pain, muscle weakness, and increased risk of fractures.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, imaging studies, and bone biopsy.
Treatment: Vitamin D and calcium supplementation, and addressing underlying causes.

Definition: Osteoporosis is a condition characterized by weak and brittle bones, increasing the risk of fractures.
Causes: Aging, hormonal changes, and nutritional deficiencies.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic until a fracture occurs; may include back pain and loss of height.
Diagnosis: Bone density tests and clinical evaluation.
Treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and lifestyle modifications.

Definition: Osteosarcoma is a type of bone cancer that typically occurs in the long bones of the arms and legs.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic factors.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, and sometimes radiation therapy.

Definition: Otosclerosis is a condition characterized by abnormal bone growth in the middle ear, leading to hearing loss.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may have a genetic component.
Symptoms: Gradual hearing loss, tinnitus, and balance issues.
Treatment: Hearing aids and surgery to remove the stapes bone.

Definition: Ovarian cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the ovaries.
Causes: Genetic mutations, family history, and age.
Symptoms: Abdominal bloating, pelvic pain, and changes in appetite.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, blood tests, and biopsy.

Definition: Ovarian cysts are fluid-filled sacs that develop on the ovaries.
Causes: Hormonal changes, menstrual cycle, and pregnancy.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic; may include pelvic pain and bloating.
Treatment: Monitoring, hormonal contraceptives, and surgery in some cases.

Definition: Overactive bladder is a condition characterized by an urgent need to urinate frequently.
Causes: Nerve damage, bladder inflammation, and certain medications.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, and bladder training.
